pros: Friendly people, amazing staff, great resources for growth and development.
cons: Long training. A lot to learn. Pressure with the absorption of the material to implement.

job_title: Help Desk Coordinator in Spokane, WA
cons:
- the pay. It is thrown in your face when you do something wrong
- a person working there forever thinks they are the top dog. If you cross her then you start hearing a lot of false drama about you from upper management in different departments. everyone feels they need to be careful around this person. it is actually pretty funny watching them surround and please her. 
- no one respects the Help Desk. there is no way out for almost everyone who has worked there from the last 10 years...no way to progress.

pros: Dedicated employees, extensive orientation, variety of patients
cons: In the past 5 years a lot of changes have happened, particularly at St. Lukes Rehab downtown. The therapy management is not supportive of staff, benefits have steadily declined, and pay is not competitive. That being said, other areas that St. Luke's has staff are much better. Enjoyed my time in acute care and outpatient. Management seems more proactive, supportive, and in tune with staff.

review_title: INHS is a stellar place to be employed.
job_title: Systems Analyst IV Leader in Spokane, WA
pros:
Pros: Depth into the Hospital IT industry. Inland Northwest Health Services represents a collaborative approach to health care that is unlike any other. With forward-thinking solutions, unique partnerships and innovative technologies, they bring safer, more cost-effective and higher quality health care to Spokane, the Northwest and the nation.

Collaboration drives everything they do; educating patients, improving access to health care, facilitating the sharing of resources among providers, developing new efficiencies through the smart use of technology and more.
cons: Limited to depth into the Hospital IT industry.

pros: The people were great.   It had a small company feel.
cons: After being absorbed by Providence the atmosphere changed.  They lost their identity.

pros: Excellent benefits, salary and location of office (downtown)
cons: Lack of advancement in learning and educational opportunities

pros: Great benefits, work environment, and team members.
cons: Alignment with Providence Health Care has many employees worried about the future of the company.

pros: The people you work with are mostly great
cons: Lack of direction and support from management. No give a dang at all from upper management. Doctors are allowed to get away with ridiculous behavior because they’re doctors. Always pressured to do more.
